inclusion.criterion: Type 2 Diabetes defined according to ADA criteria
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability for patient or legally authorized representative to understand and sign an informed consent document
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with conditions that are anticipated to have short term (i.e. < 2 months survival) based on discussions with the treatment team and attending physician.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects admitted to the CT ICU or any unit with pre-established protocols for glycemic management.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with known type 1 diabetes (who will absolutely require a long or intermediate acting insulin preparation).
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with known type 2 diabetes who currently receive 30 units or more of an intermediate or long acting insulin.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has had type 1 diabetes for 11 years and reports that he is currently homeless, having lost his supply of insulin. He has been on insulin since diagnosis and has never been prescribed oral agents.
